scenario_1.persona_desc: A Lithuanian poet, translator, and dissident who has lived abroad for many years, particularly in the United States and Germany. Known for his contributions to Lithuanian literature and his work as a poet turned dissident. His poetry often evokes the presence of the past and the transitoriness of all present. He has a deep understanding of the Lithuanian language and culture, and has translated many works into Lithuanian. He is a respected figure in the Lithuanian literary community and has been involved in political activism.
scenario_1.thought: As a Lithuanian poet and former dissident, my life has been marked by a focus on principles and a sense of community. I've seen firsthand the struggles for equality and justice. While the difference between 400 and 750 is significant, the fact that I receive the same amount regardless allows me to focus on the other person's well-being. Choosing the right option gives Person A a considerably larger amount, which, from a utilitarian perspective, benefits the group more. Furthermore, my background as a dissident suggests a tendency toward challenging perceived inequalities. Since I get 400 regardless, it seems almost spiteful to choose the left option. Therefore, I will choose the right option, as it distributes more resources overall.

The smaller personal sacrifice is worth the greater benefit to another individual. It reminds me of the ethos of solidarity we fostered during times of oppression, a spirit that I still hold dear. Therefore, I choose the option that benefits the other person to a greater extent.
